00057 //---------------------------------INTERSECTION FUNCTIONS--------------------
00058 
00059 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_ray_tri_doc,
00060 ".. function:: intersect_ray_tri(v1, v2, v3, ray, orig, clip=True)\n"
00061 "\n"
00062 "   Returns the intersection between a ray and a triangle, if possible, returns None otherwise.\n"
00063 "\n"
00064 "   :arg v1: Point1\n"
00065 "   :type v1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00066 "   :arg v2: Point2\n"
00067 "   :type v2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00068 "   :arg v3: Point3\n"
00069 "   :type v3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00070 "   :arg ray: Direction of the projection\n"
00071 "   :type ray: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00072 "   :arg orig: Origin\n"
00073 "   :type orig: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00074 "   :arg clip: When False, don't restrict the intersection to the area of the triangle, use the infinite plane defined by the triangle.\n"
00075 "   :type clip: boolean\n"
00076 "   :return: The point of intersection or None if no intersection is found\n"
00077 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector` or None\n"
00078 );
00079 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_ray_tri(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00080 {
00081     VectorObject *ray, *ray_off, *vec1, *vec2, *vec3;
00082     float dir[3], orig[3], v1[3], v2[3], v3[3], e1[3], e2[3], pvec[3], tvec[3], qvec[3];
00083     float det, inv_det, u, v, t;
00084     int clip = 1;
00085 
00086     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args,
00087                           "O!O!O!O!O!|i:intersect_ray_tri",
00088                           &vector_Type, &vec1,
00089                           &vector_Type, &vec2,
00090                           &vector_Type, &vec3,
00091                           &vector_Type, &ray,
00092                           &vector_Type, &ray_off, &clip))
00093     {
00094         return NULL;
00095     }
00096     if (vec1->size != 3 || vec2->size != 3 || vec3->size != 3 || ray->size != 3 || ray_off->size != 3) {
00097         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00098                         "only 3D vectors for all parameters");
00099         return NULL;
00100     }
00101 
00102     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec1) == -1 ||
00103         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec2) == -1 ||
00104         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec3) == -1 ||
00105         BaseMath_ReadCallback(ray)  == -1 ||
00106         BaseMath_ReadCallback(ray_off) == -1)
00107     {
00108         return NULL;
00109     }
00110 
00111     copy_v3_v3(v1, vec1->vec);
00112     copy_v3_v3(v2, vec2->vec);
00113     copy_v3_v3(v3, vec3->vec);
00114 
00115     copy_v3_v3(dir, ray->vec);
00116     normalize_v3(dir);
00117 
00118     copy_v3_v3(orig, ray_off->vec);
00119 
00120     /* find vectors for two edges sharing v1 */
00121     sub_v3_v3v3(e1, v2, v1);
00122     sub_v3_v3v3(e2, v3, v1);
00123 
00124     /* begin calculating determinant - also used to calculated U parameter */
00125     cross_v3_v3v3(pvec, dir, e2);
00126 
00127     /* if determinant is near zero, ray lies in plane of triangle */
00128     det = dot_v3v3(e1, pvec);
00129 
00130     if (det > -0.000001f && det < 0.000001f) {
00131         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00132     }
00133 
00134     inv_det = 1.0f / det;
00135 
00136     /* calculate distance from v1 to ray origin */
00137     sub_v3_v3v3(tvec, orig, v1);
00138 
00139     /* calculate U parameter and test bounds */
00140     u = dot_v3v3(tvec, pvec) * inv_det;
00141     if (clip && (u < 0.0f || u > 1.0f)) {
00142         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00143     }
00144 
00145     /* prepare to test the V parameter */
00146     cross_v3_v3v3(qvec, tvec, e1);
00147 
00148     /* calculate V parameter and test bounds */
00149     v = dot_v3v3(dir, qvec) * inv_det;
00150 
00151     if (clip && (v < 0.0f || u + v > 1.0f)) {
00152         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00153     }
00154 
00155     /* calculate t, ray intersects triangle */
00156     t = dot_v3v3(e2, qvec) * inv_det;
00157 
00158     mul_v3_fl(dir, t);
00159     add_v3_v3v3(pvec, orig, dir);
00160 
00161     return Vector_CreatePyObject(pvec, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
00162 }

00164 /* Line-Line intersection using algorithm from mathworld.wolfram.com */
00165 
00166 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_line_line_doc,
00167 ".. function:: intersect_line_line(v1, v2, v3, v4)\n"
00168 "\n"
00169 "   Returns a tuple with the points on each line respectively closest to the other.\n"
00170 "\n"
00171 "   :arg v1: First point of the first line\n"
00172 "   :type v1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00173 "   :arg v2: Second point of the first line\n"
00174 "   :type v2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00175 "   :arg v3: First point of the second line\n"
00176 "   :type v3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00177 "   :arg v4: Second point of the second line\n"
00178 "   :type v4: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00179 "   :rtype: tuple of :class:`mathutils.Vector`'s\n"
00180 );
00181 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_line_line(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00182 {
00183     PyObject *tuple;
00184     VectorObject *vec1, *vec2, *vec3, *vec4;
00185     float v1[3], v2[3], v3[3], v4[3], i1[3], i2[3];
00186 
00187     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!:intersect_line_line",
00188                           &vector_Type, &vec1,
00189                           &vector_Type, &vec2,
00190                           &vector_Type, &vec3,
00191                           &vector_Type, &vec4))
00192     {
00193         return NULL;
00194     }
00195 
00196     if (vec1->size != vec2->size || vec1->size != vec3->size || vec3->size != vec2->size) {
00197         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00198                         "vectors must be of the same size");
00199         return NULL;
00200     }
00201 
00202     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec1) == -1 ||
00203         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec2) == -1 ||
00204         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec3) == -1 ||
00205         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec4) == -1)
00206     {
00207         return NULL;
00208     }
00209 
00210     if (vec1->size == 3 || vec1->size == 2) {
00211         int result;
00212 
00213         if (vec1->size == 3) {
00214             copy_v3_v3(v1, vec1->vec);
00215             copy_v3_v3(v2, vec2->vec);
00216             copy_v3_v3(v3, vec3->vec);
00217             copy_v3_v3(v4, vec4->vec);
00218         }
00219         else {
00220             v1[0] = vec1->vec[0];
00221             v1[1] = vec1->vec[1];
00222             v1[2] = 0.0f;
00223 
00224             v2[0] = vec2->vec[0];
00225             v2[1] = vec2->vec[1];
00226             v2[2] = 0.0f;
00227 
00228             v3[0] = vec3->vec[0];
00229             v3[1] = vec3->vec[1];
00230             v3[2] = 0.0f;
00231 
00232             v4[0] = vec4->vec[0];
00233             v4[1] = vec4->vec[1];
00234             v4[2] = 0.0f;
00235         }
00236 
00237         result = isect_line_line_v3(v1, v2, v3, v4, i1, i2);
00238 
00239         if (result == 0) {
00240             /* colinear */
00241             Py_RETURN_NONE;
00242         }
00243         else {
00244             tuple = PyTuple_New(2);
00245             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(tuple, 0, Vector_CreatePyObject(i1, vec1->size, Py_NEW, NULL));
00246             PyTuple_SET_ITEM(tuple, 1, Vector_CreatePyObject(i2, vec1->size, Py_NEW, NULL));
00247             return tuple;
00248         }
00249     }
00250     else {
00251         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00252                         "2D/3D vectors only");
00253         return NULL;
00254     }
00255 }

00261 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_normal_doc,
00262 ".. function:: normal(v1, v2, v3, v4=None)\n"
00263 "\n"
00264 "   Returns the normal of the 3D tri or quad.\n"
00265 "\n"
00266 "   :arg v1: Point1\n"
00267 "   :type v1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00268 "   :arg v2: Point2\n"
00269 "   :type v2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00270 "   :arg v3: Point3\n"
00271 "   :type v3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00272 "   :arg v4: Point4 (optional)\n"
00273 "   :type v4: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00274 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00275 );
00276 static PyObject *M_Geometry_normal(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00277 {
00278     VectorObject *vec1, *vec2, *vec3, *vec4;
00279     float n[3];
00280 
00281     if (PyTuple_GET_SIZE(args) == 3) {
00282         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!:normal",
00283                               &vector_Type, &vec1,
00284                               &vector_Type, &vec2,
00285                               &vector_Type, &vec3))
00286         {
00287             return NULL;
00288         }
00289 
00290         if (vec1->size != vec2->size || vec1->size != vec3->size) {
00291             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00292                             "vectors must be of the same size");
00293             return NULL;
00294         }
00295         if (vec1->size < 3) {
00296             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00297                             "2D vectors unsupported");
00298             return NULL;
00299         }
00300 
00301         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec1) == -1 ||
00302             BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec2) == -1 ||
00303             BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec3) == -1)
00304         {
00305             return NULL;
00306         }
00307 
00308         normal_tri_v3(n, vec1->vec, vec2->vec, vec3->vec);
00309     }
00310     else {
00311         if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!:normal",
00312                               &vector_Type, &vec1,
00313                               &vector_Type, &vec2,
00314                               &vector_Type, &vec3,
00315                               &vector_Type, &vec4))
00316         {
00317             return NULL;
00318         }
00319         if (vec1->size != vec2->size || vec1->size != vec3->size || vec1->size != vec4->size) {
00320             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00321                             "vectors must be of the same size");
00322             return NULL;
00323         }
00324         if (vec1->size < 3) {
00325             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00326                             "2D vectors unsupported");
00327             return NULL;
00328         }
00329 
00330         if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec1) == -1 ||
00331             BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec2) == -1 ||
00332             BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec3) == -1 ||
00333             BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec4) == -1)
00334         {
00335             return NULL;
00336         }
00337 
00338         normal_quad_v3(n, vec1->vec, vec2->vec, vec3->vec, vec4->vec);
00339     }
00340 
00341     return Vector_CreatePyObject(n, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
00342 }

00346 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_area_tri_doc,
00347 ".. function:: area_tri(v1, v2, v3)\n"
00348 "\n"
00349 "   Returns the area size of the 2D or 3D triangle defined.\n"
00350 "\n"
00351 "   :arg v1: Point1\n"
00352 "   :type v1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00353 "   :arg v2: Point2\n"
00354 "   :type v2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00355 "   :arg v3: Point3\n"
00356 "   :type v3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00357 "   :rtype: float\n"
00358 );
00359 static PyObject *M_Geometry_area_tri(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00360 {
00361     VectorObject *vec1, *vec2, *vec3;
00362 
00363     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!:area_tri",
00364                           &vector_Type, &vec1,
00365                           &vector_Type, &vec2,
00366                           &vector_Type, &vec3))
00367     {
00368         return NULL;
00369     }
00370 
00371     if (vec1->size != vec2->size || vec1->size != vec3->size) {
00372         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00373                         "vectors must be of the same size");
00374         return NULL;
00375     }
00376 
00377     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec1) == -1 ||
00378         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec2) == -1 ||
00379         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec3) == -1)
00380     {
00381         return NULL;
00382     }
00383 
00384     if (vec1->size == 3) {
00385         return PyFloat_FromDouble(area_tri_v3(vec1->vec, vec2->vec, vec3->vec));
00386     }
00387     else if (vec1->size == 2) {
00388         return PyFloat_FromDouble(area_tri_v2(vec1->vec, vec2->vec, vec3->vec));
00389     }
00390     else {
00391         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00392                         "only 2D,3D vectors are supported");
00393         return NULL;
00394     }
00395 }

00398 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_line_line_2d_doc,
00399 ".. function:: intersect_line_line_2d(lineA_p1, lineA_p2, lineB_p1, lineB_p2)\n"
00400 "\n"
00401 "   Takes 2 lines (as 4 vectors) and returns a vector for their point of intersection or None.\n"
00402 "\n"
00403 "   :arg lineA_p1: First point of the first line\n"
00404 "   :type lineA_p1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00405 "   :arg lineA_p2: Second point of the first line\n"
00406 "   :type lineA_p2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00407 "   :arg lineB_p1: First point of the second line\n"
00408 "   :type lineB_p1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00409 "   :arg lineB_p2: Second point of the second line\n"
00410 "   :type lineB_p2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00411 "   :return: The point of intersection or None when not found\n"
00412 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector` or None\n"
00413 );
00414 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_line_line_2d(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00415 {
00416     VectorObject *line_a1, *line_a2, *line_b1, *line_b2;
00417     float vi[2];
00418     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!:intersect_line_line_2d",
00419                           &vector_Type, &line_a1,
00420                           &vector_Type, &line_a2,
00421                           &vector_Type, &line_b1,
00422                           &vector_Type, &line_b2))
00423     {
00424         return NULL;
00425     }
00426     
00427     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_a1) == -1 ||
00428         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_a2) == -1 ||
00429         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_b1) == -1 ||
00430         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_b2) == -1)
00431     {
00432         return NULL;
00433     }
00434 
00435     if (isect_seg_seg_v2_point(line_a1->vec, line_a2->vec, line_b1->vec, line_b2->vec, vi) == 1) {
00436         return Vector_CreatePyObject(vi, 2, Py_NEW, NULL);
00437     }
00438     else {
00439         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00440     }
00441 }

00444 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_line_plane_doc,
00445 ".. function:: intersect_line_plane(line_a, line_b, plane_co, plane_no, no_flip=False)\n"
00446 "\n"
00447 "   Calculate the intersection between a line (as 2 vectors) and a plane.\n"
00448 "   Returns a vector for the intersection or None.\n"
00449 "\n"
00450 "   :arg line_a: First point of the first line\n"
00451 "   :type line_a: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00452 "   :arg line_b: Second point of the first line\n"
00453 "   :type line_b: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00454 "   :arg plane_co: A point on the plane\n"
00455 "   :type plane_co: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00456 "   :arg plane_no: The direction the plane is facing\n"
00457 "   :type plane_no: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00458 "   :arg no_flip: Always return an intersection on the directon defined bt line_a -> line_b\n"
00459 "   :type no_flip: :boolean\n"
00460 "   :return: The point of intersection or None when not found\n"
00461 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector` or None\n"
00462 );
00463 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_line_plane(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00464 {
00465     VectorObject *line_a, *line_b, *plane_co, *plane_no;
00466     int no_flip = 0;
00467     float isect[3];
00468     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!|i:intersect_line_plane",
00469                           &vector_Type, &line_a,
00470                           &vector_Type, &line_b,
00471                           &vector_Type, &plane_co,
00472                           &vector_Type, &plane_no,
00473                           &no_flip))
00474     {
00475         return NULL;
00476     }
00477 
00478     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_a) == -1 ||
00479         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_b) == -1 ||
00480         BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_co) == -1 ||
00481         BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_no) == -1)
00482     {
00483         return NULL;
00484     }
00485 
00486     if (ELEM4(2, line_a->size, line_b->size, plane_co->size, plane_no->size)) {
00487         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00488                         "geometry.intersect_line_plane(...): "
00489                         " can't use 2D Vectors");
00490         return NULL;
00491     }
00492 
00493     if (isect_line_plane_v3(isect, line_a->vec, line_b->vec, plane_co->vec, plane_no->vec, no_flip) == 1) {
00494         return Vector_CreatePyObject(isect, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
00495     }
00496     else {
00497         Py_RETURN_NONE;
00498     }
00499 }

00501 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_plane_plane_doc,
00502 ".. function:: intersect_plane_plane(plane_a_co, plane_a_no, plane_b_co, plane_b_no)\n"
00503 "\n"
00504 "   Return the intersection between two planes\n"
00505 "\n"
00506 "   :arg plane_a_co: Point on the first plane\n"
00507 "   :type plane_a_co: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00508 "   :arg plane_a_no: Normal of the first plane\n"
00509 "   :type plane_a_no: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00510 "   :arg plane_b_co: Point on the second plane\n"
00511 "   :type plane_b_co: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00512 "   :arg plane_b_no: Normal of the second plane\n"
00513 "   :type plane_b_no: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00514 "   :return: The line of the intersection represented as a point and a vector\n"
00515 "   :rtype: tuple pair of :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00516 );
00517 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_plane_plane(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00518 {
00519     PyObject *ret;
00520     VectorObject *plane_a_co, *plane_a_no, *plane_b_co, *plane_b_no;
00521 
00522     float isect_co[3];
00523     float isect_no[3];
00524 
00525     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!|i:intersect_plane_plane",
00526                           &vector_Type, &plane_a_co,
00527                           &vector_Type, &plane_a_no,
00528                           &vector_Type, &plane_b_co,
00529                           &vector_Type, &plane_b_no))
00530     {
00531         return NULL;
00532     }
00533 
00534     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_a_co) == -1 ||
00535         BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_a_no) == -1 ||
00536         BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_b_co) == -1 ||
00537         BaseMath_ReadCallback(plane_b_no) == -1)
00538     {
00539         return NULL;
00540     }
00541 
00542     if (ELEM4(2, plane_a_co->size, plane_a_no->size, plane_b_co->size, plane_b_no->size)) {
00543         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00544                         "geometry.intersect_plane_plane(...): "
00545                         " can't use 2D Vectors");
00546         return NULL;
00547     }
00548 
00549     isect_plane_plane_v3(isect_co, isect_no,
00550                          plane_a_co->vec, plane_a_no->vec,
00551                          plane_b_co->vec, plane_b_no->vec);
00552 
00553     normalize_v3(isect_no);
00554 
00555     ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00556     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, Vector_CreatePyObject(isect_co, 3, Py_NEW, NULL));
00557     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, Vector_CreatePyObject(isect_no, 3, Py_NEW, NULL));
00558     return ret;
00559 }
00560 
00561 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_line_sphere_doc,
00562 ".. function:: intersect_line_sphere(line_a, line_b, sphere_co, sphere_radius, clip=True)\n"
00563 "\n"
00564 "   Takes a lines (as 2 vectors), a sphere as a point and a radius and\n"
00565 "   returns the intersection\n"
00566 "\n"
00567 "   :arg line_a: First point of the first line\n"
00568 "   :type line_a: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00569 "   :arg line_b: Second point of the first line\n"
00570 "   :type line_b: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00571 "   :arg sphere_co: The center of the sphere\n"
00572 "   :type sphere_co: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00573 "   :arg sphere_radius: Radius of the sphere\n"
00574 "   :type sphere_radius: sphere_radius\n"
00575 "   :return: The intersection points as a pair of vectors or None when there is no intersection\n"
00576 "   :rtype: A tuple pair containing :class:`mathutils.Vector` or None\n"
00577 );
00578 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_line_sphere(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00579 {
00580     VectorObject *line_a, *line_b, *sphere_co;
00581     float sphere_radius;
00582     int clip = TRUE;
00583 
00584     float isect_a[3];
00585     float isect_b[3];
00586 
00587     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!f|i:intersect_line_sphere",
00588                           &vector_Type, &line_a,
00589                           &vector_Type, &line_b,
00590                           &vector_Type, &sphere_co,
00591                           &sphere_radius, &clip))
00592     {
00593         return NULL;
00594     }
00595 
00596     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_a) == -1 ||
00597         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_b) == -1 ||
00598         BaseMath_ReadCallback(sphere_co) == -1)
00599     {
00600         return NULL;
00601     }
00602 
00603     if (ELEM3(2, line_a->size, line_b->size, sphere_co->size)) {
00604         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00605                         "geometry.intersect_line_sphere(...): "
00606                         " can't use 2D Vectors");
00607         return NULL;
00608     }
00609     else {
00610         short use_a = TRUE;
00611         short use_b = TRUE;
00612         float lambda;
00613 
00614         PyObject *ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00615 
00616         switch (isect_line_sphere_v3(line_a->vec, line_b->vec, sphere_co->vec, sphere_radius, isect_a, isect_b)) {
00617             case 1:
00618                 if (!(!clip || (((lambda = line_point_factor_v3(isect_a, line_a->vec, line_b->vec)) >= 0.0f) && (lambda <= 1.0f)))) use_a = FALSE;
00619                 use_b = FALSE;
00620                 break;
00621             case 2:
00622                 if (!(!clip || (((lambda = line_point_factor_v3(isect_a, line_a->vec, line_b->vec)) >= 0.0f) && (lambda <= 1.0f)))) use_a = FALSE;
00623                 if (!(!clip || (((lambda = line_point_factor_v3(isect_b, line_a->vec, line_b->vec)) >= 0.0f) && (lambda <= 1.0f)))) use_b = FALSE;
00624                 break;
00625             default:
00626                 use_a = FALSE;
00627                 use_b = FALSE;
00628         }
00629 
00630         if (use_a) { PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0,  Vector_CreatePyObject(isect_a, 3, Py_NEW, NULL)); }
00631         else       { PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0,  Py_None); Py_INCREF(Py_None); }
00632 
00633         if (use_b) { PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1,  Vector_CreatePyObject(isect_b, 3, Py_NEW, NULL)); }
00634         else       { PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1,  Py_None); Py_INCREF(Py_None); }
00635 
00636         return ret;
00637     }
00638 }
00639

00672     {
00673         return NULL;
00674     }
00675

00692                 use_b = FALSE;

00696                 if (!(!clip || (((lambda = line_point_factor_v2(isect_b, line_a->vec, line_b->vec)) >= 0.0f) && (lambda <= 1.0f)))) use_b = FALSE;

00713 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_intersect_point_line_doc,
00714 ".. function:: intersect_point_line(pt, line_p1, line_p2)\n"
00715 "\n"
00716 "   Takes a point and a line and returns a tuple with the closest point on the line and its distance from the first point of the line as a percentage of the length of the line.\n"
00717 "\n"
00718 "   :arg pt: Point\n"
00719 "   :type pt: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00720 "   :arg line_p1: First point of the line\n"
00721 "   :type line_p1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00722 "   :arg line_p1: Second point of the line\n"
00723 "   :type line_p1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00724 "   :rtype: (:class:`mathutils.Vector`, float)\n"
00725 );
00726 static PyObject *M_Geometry_intersect_point_line(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00727 {
00728     VectorObject *pt, *line_1, *line_2;
00729     float pt_in[3], pt_out[3], l1[3], l2[3];
00730     float lambda;
00731     PyObject *ret;
00732     
00733     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!:intersect_point_line",
00734                           &vector_Type, &pt,
00735                           &vector_Type, &line_1,
00736                           &vector_Type, &line_2))
00737     {
00738         return NULL;
00739     }
00740 
00741     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(pt) == -1 ||
00742         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_1) == -1 ||
00743         BaseMath_ReadCallback(line_2) == -1)
00744     {
00745         return NULL;
00746     }
00747 
00748     /* accept 2d verts */
00749     if (pt->size == 3) {     copy_v3_v3(pt_in, pt->vec); }
00750     else { pt_in[2] = 0.0f;  copy_v2_v2(pt_in, pt->vec); }
00751     
00752     if (line_1->size == 3) { copy_v3_v3(l1, line_1->vec); }
00753     else { l1[2] = 0.0f;     copy_v2_v2(l1, line_1->vec); }
00754     
00755     if (line_2->size == 3) { copy_v3_v3(l2, line_2->vec); }
00756     else { l2[2] = 0.0f;     copy_v2_v2(l2, line_2->vec); }
00757     
00758     /* do the calculation */
00759     lambda = closest_to_line_v3(pt_out, pt_in, l1, l2);
00760     
00761     ret = PyTuple_New(2);
00762     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, Vector_CreatePyObject(pt_out, 3, Py_NEW, NULL));
00763     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(lambda));
00764     return ret;
00765 }

00886 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_barycentric_transform_doc,
00887 ".. function:: barycentric_transform(point, tri_a1, tri_a2, tri_a3, tri_b1, tri_b2, tri_b3)\n"
00888 "\n"
00889 "   Return a transformed point, the transformation is defined by 2 triangles.\n"
00890 "\n"
00891 "   :arg point: The point to transform.\n"
00892 "   :type point: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00893 "   :arg tri_a1: source triangle vertex.\n"
00894 "   :type tri_a1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00895 "   :arg tri_a2: source triangle vertex.\n"
00896 "   :type tri_a2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00897 "   :arg tri_a3: source triangle vertex.\n"
00898 "   :type tri_a3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00899 "   :arg tri_a1: target triangle vertex.\n"
00900 "   :type tri_a1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00901 "   :arg tri_a2: target triangle vertex.\n"
00902 "   :type tri_a2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00903 "   :arg tri_a3: target triangle vertex.\n"
00904 "   :type tri_a3: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00905 "   :return: The transformed point\n"
00906 "   :rtype: :class:`mathutils.Vector`'s\n"
00907 );
00908 static PyObject *M_Geometry_barycentric_transform(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00909 {
00910     VectorObject *vec_pt;
00911     VectorObject *vec_t1_tar, *vec_t2_tar, *vec_t3_tar;
00912     VectorObject *vec_t1_src, *vec_t2_src, *vec_t3_src;
00913     float vec[3];
00914 
00915     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!O!O!O!:barycentric_transform",
00916                           &vector_Type, &vec_pt,
00917                           &vector_Type, &vec_t1_src,
00918                           &vector_Type, &vec_t2_src,
00919                           &vector_Type, &vec_t3_src,
00920                           &vector_Type, &vec_t1_tar,
00921                           &vector_Type, &vec_t2_tar,
00922                           &vector_Type, &vec_t3_tar))
00923     {
00924         return NULL;
00925     }
00926 
00927     if (vec_pt->size != 3 ||
00928         vec_t1_src->size != 3 ||
00929         vec_t2_src->size != 3 ||
00930         vec_t3_src->size != 3 ||
00931         vec_t1_tar->size != 3 ||
00932         vec_t2_tar->size != 3 ||
00933         vec_t3_tar->size != 3)
00934     {
00935         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00936                         "One of more of the vector arguments wasn't a 3D vector");
00937         return NULL;
00938     }
00939 
00940     barycentric_transform(vec, vec_pt->vec,
00941                           vec_t1_tar->vec, vec_t2_tar->vec, vec_t3_tar->vec,
00942                           vec_t1_src->vec, vec_t2_src->vec, vec_t3_src->vec);
00943 
00944     return Vector_CreatePyObject(vec, 3, Py_NEW, NULL);
00945 }

00948 
00949 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_interpolate_bezier_doc,
00950 ".. function:: interpolate_bezier(knot1, handle1, handle2, knot2, resolution)\n"
00951 "\n"
00952 "   Interpolate a bezier spline segment.\n"
00953 "\n"
00954 "   :arg knot1: First bezier spline point.\n"
00955 "   :type knot1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00956 "   :arg handle1: First bezier spline handle.\n"
00957 "   :type handle1: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00958 "   :arg handle2: Second bezier spline handle.\n"
00959 "   :type handle2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00960 "   :arg knot2: Second bezier spline point.\n"
00961 "   :type knot2: :class:`mathutils.Vector`\n"
00962 "   :arg resolution: Number of points to return.\n"
00963 "   :type resolution: int\n"
00964 "   :return: The interpolated points\n"
00965 "   :rtype: list of :class:`mathutils.Vector`'s\n"
00966 );
00967 static PyObject *M_Geometry_interpolate_bezier(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *args)
00968 {
00969     VectorObject *vec_k1, *vec_h1, *vec_k2, *vec_h2;
00970     int resolu;
00971     int dims;
00972     int i;
00973     float *coord_array, *fp;
00974     PyObject *list;
00975 
00976     float k1[4] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00977     float h1[4] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00978     float k2[4] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00979     float h2[4] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
00980 
00981 
00982     if (!PyArg_ParseTuple(args, "O!O!O!O!i:interpolate_bezier",
00983                           &vector_Type, &vec_k1,
00984                           &vector_Type, &vec_h1,
00985                           &vector_Type, &vec_h2,
00986                           &vector_Type, &vec_k2, &resolu))
00987     {
00988         return NULL;
00989     }
00990 
00991     if (resolu <= 1) {
00992         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_ValueError,
00993                         "resolution must be 2 or over");
00994         return NULL;
00995     }
00996 
00997     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec_k1) == -1 ||
00998         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec_h1) == -1 ||
00999         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec_k2) == -1 ||
01000         BaseMath_ReadCallback(vec_h2) == -1)
01001     {
01002         return NULL;
01003     }
01004 
01005     dims = MAX4(vec_k1->size, vec_h1->size, vec_h2->size, vec_k2->size);
01006 
01007     for (i = 0; i < vec_k1->size; i++) k1[i] = vec_k1->vec[i];
01008     for (i = 0; i < vec_h1->size; i++) h1[i] = vec_h1->vec[i];
01009     for (i = 0; i < vec_k2->size; i++) k2[i] = vec_k2->vec[i];
01010     for (i = 0; i < vec_h2->size; i++) h2[i] = vec_h2->vec[i];
01011 
01012     coord_array = MEM_callocN(dims * (resolu) * sizeof(float), "interpolate_bezier");
01013     for (i = 0; i < dims; i++) {
01014         forward_diff_bezier(k1[i], h1[i], h2[i], k2[i], coord_array + i, resolu - 1, sizeof(float) * dims);
01015     }
01016 
01017     list = PyList_New(resolu);
01018     fp = coord_array;
01019     for (i = 0; i < resolu; i++, fp = fp + dims) {
01020         PyList_SET_ITEM(list, i, Vector_CreatePyObject(fp, dims, Py_NEW, NULL));
01021     }
01022     MEM_freeN(coord_array);
01023     return list;
01024 }
01025 
01026 
01027 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_tessellate_polygon_doc,
01028 ".. function:: tessellate_polygon(veclist_list)\n"
01029 "\n"
01030 "   Takes a list of polylines (each point a vector) and returns the point indices for a polyline filled with triangles.\n"
01031 "\n"
01032 "   :arg veclist_list: list of polylines\n"
01033 "   :rtype: list\n"
01034 );
01035 /* PolyFill function, uses Blenders scanfill to fill multiple poly lines */
01036 static PyObject *M_Geometry_tessellate_polygon(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *polyLineSeq)
01037 {
01038     PyObject *tri_list; /*return this list of tri's */
01039     PyObject *polyLine, *polyVec;
01040     int i, len_polylines, len_polypoints, ls_error = 0;
01041 
01042     /* display listbase */
01043     ListBase dispbase = {NULL, NULL};
01044     DispList *dl;
01045     float *fp; /*pointer to the array of malloced dl->verts to set the points from the vectors */
01046     int index, *dl_face, totpoints = 0;
01047 
01048     if (!PySequence_Check(polyLineSeq)) {
01049         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01050                         "expected a sequence of poly lines");
01051         return NULL;
01052     }
01053 
01054     len_polylines = PySequence_Size(polyLineSeq);
01055 
01056     for (i = 0; i < len_polylines; i++) {
01057         polyLine = PySequence_GetItem(polyLineSeq, i);
01058         if (!PySequence_Check(polyLine)) {
01059             freedisplist(&dispbase);
01060             Py_XDECREF(polyLine); /* may be null so use Py_XDECREF*/
01061             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01062                             "One or more of the polylines is not a sequence of mathutils.Vector's");
01063             return NULL;
01064         }
01065 
01066         len_polypoints = PySequence_Size(polyLine);
01067         if (len_polypoints > 0) { /* don't bother adding edges as polylines */
01068 #if 0
01069             if (EXPP_check_sequence_consistency(polyLine, &vector_Type) != 1) {
01070                 freedisplist(&dispbase);
01071                 Py_DECREF(polyLine);
01072                 PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01073                                 "A point in one of the polylines is not a mathutils.Vector type");
01074                 return NULL;
01075             }
01076 #endif
01077             dl = MEM_callocN(sizeof(DispList), "poly disp");
01078             BLI_addtail(&dispbase, dl);
01079             dl->type = DL_INDEX3;
01080             dl->nr = len_polypoints;
01081             dl->type = DL_POLY;
01082             dl->parts = 1; /* no faces, 1 edge loop */
01083             dl->col = 0; /* no material */
01084             dl->verts = fp = MEM_callocN(sizeof(float) * 3 * len_polypoints, "dl verts");
01085             dl->index = MEM_callocN(sizeof(int) * 3 * len_polypoints, "dl index");
01086 
01087             for (index = 0; index < len_polypoints; index++, fp += 3) {
01088                 polyVec = PySequence_GetItem(polyLine, index);
01089                 if (VectorObject_Check(polyVec)) {
01090 
01091                     if (BaseMath_ReadCallback((VectorObject *)polyVec) == -1)
01092                         ls_error = 1;
01093 
01094                     fp[0] = ((VectorObject *)polyVec)->vec[0];
01095                     fp[1] = ((VectorObject *)polyVec)->vec[1];
01096                     if (((VectorObject *)polyVec)->size > 2)
01097                         fp[2] = ((VectorObject *)polyVec)->vec[2];
01098                     else
01099                         fp[2] = 0.0f;  /* if its a 2d vector then set the z to be zero */
01100                 }
01101                 else {
01102                     ls_error = 1;
01103                 }
01104 
01105                 totpoints++;
01106                 Py_DECREF(polyVec);
01107             }
01108         }
01109         Py_DECREF(polyLine);
01110     }
01111 
01112     if (ls_error) {
01113         freedisplist(&dispbase); /* possible some dl was allocated */
01114         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01115                         "A point in one of the polylines "
01116                         "is not a mathutils.Vector type");
01117         return NULL;
01118     }
01119     else if (totpoints) {
01120         /* now make the list to return */
01121         filldisplist(&dispbase, &dispbase, 0);
01122 
01123         /* The faces are stored in a new DisplayList
01124          * thats added to the head of the listbase */
01125         dl = dispbase.first;
01126 
01127         tri_list = PyList_New(dl->parts);
01128         if (!tri_list) {
01129             freedisplist(&dispbase);
01130             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_RuntimeError,
01131                             "failed to make a new list");
01132             return NULL;
01133         }
01134 
01135         index = 0;
01136         dl_face = dl->index;
01137         while (index < dl->parts) {
01138             PyList_SET_ITEM(tri_list, index, Py_BuildValue("iii", dl_face[0], dl_face[1], dl_face[2]));
01139             dl_face += 3;
01140             index++;
01141         }
01142         freedisplist(&dispbase);
01143     }
01144     else {
01145         /* no points, do this so scripts don't barf */
01146         freedisplist(&dispbase); /* possible some dl was allocated */
01147         tri_list = PyList_New(0);
01148     }
01149 
01150     return tri_list;
01151 }
01152 
01153 
01154 static int boxPack_FromPyObject(PyObject *value, boxPack **boxarray)
01155 {
01156     Py_ssize_t len, i;
01157     PyObject *list_item, *item_1, *item_2;
01158     boxPack *box;
01159 
01160 
01161     /* Error checking must already be done */
01162     if (!PyList_Check(value)) {
01163         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01164                         "can only back a list of [x, y, w, h]");
01165         return -1;
01166     }
01167 
01168     len = PyList_GET_SIZE(value);
01169 
01170     *boxarray = MEM_mallocN(len * sizeof(boxPack), "boxPack box");
01171 
01172 
01173     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
01174         list_item = PyList_GET_ITEM(value, i);
01175         if (!PyList_Check(list_item) || PyList_GET_SIZE(list_item) < 4) {
01176             MEM_freeN(*boxarray);
01177             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01178                             "can only pack a list of [x, y, w, h]");
01179             return -1;
01180         }
01181 
01182         box = (*boxarray) + i;
01183 
01184         item_1 = PyList_GET_ITEM(list_item, 2);
01185         item_2 = PyList_GET_ITEM(list_item, 3);
01186 
01187         box->w =  (float)PyFloat_AsDouble(item_1);
01188         box->h =  (float)PyFloat_AsDouble(item_2);
01189         box->index = i;
01190 
01191         /* accounts for error case too and overwrites with own error */
01192         if (box->w < 0.0f || box->h < 0.0f) {
01193             MEM_freeN(*boxarray);
01194             PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01195                             "error parsing width and height values from list: "
01196                             "[x, y, w, h], not numbers or below zero");
01197             return -1;
01198         }
01199 
01200         /* verts will be added later */
01201     }
01202     return 0;
01203 }
01204 
01205 static void boxPack_ToPyObject(PyObject *value, boxPack **boxarray)
01206 {
01207     Py_ssize_t len, i;
01208     PyObject *list_item;
01209     boxPack *box;
01210 
01211     len = PyList_GET_SIZE(value);
01212 
01213     for (i = 0; i < len; i++) {
01214         box = (*boxarray) + i;
01215         list_item = PyList_GET_ITEM(value, box->index);
01216         PyList_SET_ITEM(list_item, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(box->x));
01217         PyList_SET_ITEM(list_item, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(box->y));
01218     }
01219     MEM_freeN(*boxarray);
01220 }
01221 
01222 PyDoc_STRVAR(M_Geometry_box_pack_2d_doc,
01223 ".. function:: box_pack_2d(boxes)\n"
01224 "\n"
01225 "   Returns the normal of the 3D tri or quad.\n"
01226 "\n"
01227 "   :arg boxes: list of boxes, each box is a list where the first 4 items are [x, y, width, height, ...] other items are ignored.\n"
01228 "   :type boxes: list\n"
01229 "   :return: the width and height of the packed bounding box\n"
01230 "   :rtype: tuple, pair of floats\n"
01231 );
01232 static PyObject *M_Geometry_box_pack_2d(PyObject *UNUSED(self), PyObject *boxlist)
01233 {
01234     float tot_width = 0.0f, tot_height = 0.0f;
01235     Py_ssize_t len;
01236 
01237     PyObject *ret;
01238 
01239     if (!PyList_Check(boxlist)) {
01240         PyErr_SetString(PyExc_TypeError,
01241                         "expected a list of boxes [[x, y, w, h], ... ]");
01242         return NULL;
01243     }
01244 
01245     len = PyList_GET_SIZE(boxlist);
01246     if (len) {
01247         boxPack *boxarray = NULL;
01248         if (boxPack_FromPyObject(boxlist, &boxarray) == -1) {
01249             return NULL; /* exception set */
01250         }
01251 
01252         /* Non Python function */
01253         boxPack2D(boxarray, len, &tot_width, &tot_height);
01254 
01255         boxPack_ToPyObject(boxlist, &boxarray);
01256     }
01257 
01258     ret = PyTuple_New(2);
01259     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 0, PyFloat_FromDouble(tot_width));
01260     PyTuple_SET_ITEM(ret, 1, PyFloat_FromDouble(tot_width));
01261     return ret;
01262 }

01264 #endif /* MATH_STANDALONE */
